ecokit 0.1.0
  • Functions

Retrieve the location of the current R script.

Source: R/general_script_location.R
script_location.Rd

This function determines the file path of the currently executing R script. It checks command line arguments (e.g., via Rscript) for the script path, then in interactive sessions, it examines the call stack for the most recently sourced file, falling back to rstudioapi (if available and RStudio is running) when no sourcing context exists. If the location cannot be determined, it returns NA.

Usage

script_location()

Source

The source code of this function was adapted from this stackoverflow question.

Value

A character string representing the file path of the current R script, or NA_character_ if the path cannot be determined (e.g., in an unsourced interactive session without a script context).

Details

The function follows this priority order:

  • Command line arguments (--file) when executed via Rscript.

  • The most recent ofile attribute from the call stack when sourced interactively in any R environment, supporting nested sourcing scenarios.

  • RStudio's active editor context via rstudioapi if available, RStudio is running, and no sourcing context is found.

  • Returns NA_character_ for unsourced interactive sessions or non-interactive execution without a script path.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  # in an interactive mode, use
  script_location()

  # add script_location() to your script; e.g. "my_script.R"
  # Run: Rscript my_script.R
  # Output: absolute path of the script
} # }
